item.title: How I structure my learning
item.description: The first months after you start exercising you improve regardless of how efficiently you train, just because doing anything is better than doing nothing. These are called newbie gains and they are everywhere: we are bound to make rapid progres at pretty much almost anything that we start learning deliberately, at least in the beginning. But what happens after the newbie gains are over? You need a method. And if you are an adult leading a busy life and wanting to dig deep into a new pursuit, that method better be good.
